title: Peru: Citi and IFC Execute a US$40 Million Syndicated Loan for Mibanco
summary: Lima, Peru - Last week Citibank del Peru S.A, acting as Joint Bookrunner, successfully disbursed a US$15 million credit facility to Mibanco. The transaction, which was disbursed in local currency and had a three-year tenor, was part of a US$40 million syndicated loan to finance the expansion of Mibanco's credit portfolio. Mibanco is a leading microfinance institution in Peru.
tag-1: Peru: Citi and IFC Execute a US$40 Million Syndicated Loan for Mibanco
tag-2: Lima, Peru – Last week Citibank del Peru S.A, acting as Joint Bookrunner, successfully disbursed a US$15 million credit facility to Mibanco. The transaction, which was disbursed in local currency and had a three-year tenor, was part of a US$40 million syndicated loan to finance the expansion of Mibanco's credit portfolio. Mibanco is a leading microfinance institution in Peru.
tag-3: This transaction marks the first PEN-Indexed facility under the A/B loan structure with a multilateral institution. The Mibanco financing also reaffirms Citibank's leading position in the Latin American syndicated loans market and its commitment to supporting the microfinance industry in Peru.
tag-4: "For over 10 years, we have accompanied the growth of Mibanco and encouraged the development of microfinance in Peru. Through multiple financing transactions in the capital markets and the banking system, we seek to facilitate the access to credit in low income areas, where traditional banks have not managed to penetrate," commented Jose Gabel, Citibank Peru's Head of Financial Institutions.
tag-5: "We appreciate the renewed support and long-term relationship with Citibank and the IFC. This syndicated loan will allow us to continue helping low income clients with limited financial knowledge and reduce the social gaps between urban and rural businesses, many of which are run by women," commented Ramiro Postigo, Finance and Treasury Manager of Mibanco.
tag-6: Last March, Citibank del Perú S.A. acted as co-arranger and underwriter in the inaugural international bond offering of Grupo ACP, Mibanco's main shareholder. The issue had a size of US$85 million and a 10-year tenor and was sold to local and international investors. Proceeds from this offering were used to finance the growth of Grupo ACP's subsidiaries in Latin America.
tag-7: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions.
